column4: roadway signs are more difficult to see at night.
column6: streetlights may cause a lot of glare

column2: 2. Trucks and buses may need more space to make a right-hand turn.
4. Posted at freeway exit ramps, this sign shows:
column4: the minimum safe speed a vehicle can be driven on the ramp.
column6: the maximum safe speed a vehicle can be driven on the ramp.
column8: the suggested speed a vehicle can be driven on the ramp.

column2: 5. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column6: their lane has a solid yellow center line.

column4: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 8. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
9. If you are involved in a crash that causes damage to an unattended vehicle, you must:
column4: Notify police and complete all required crash reports.
column6: Stop your vehicle in an area away from traffic, and leave your name, address, phone number and license plate number on the vehicle, if you cannot find the owner.

column2: 10. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:

column6: show which lanes you must use.

column4: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column6: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column8: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.

column4: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 26. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:

column4: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.

column2: 28. Which shape is a warning sign?

column4: The light will soon change to steady red.
column6: The same as a STOP sign.

column2: 31. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column8: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.

column2: 32. When more than one driver reaches a four-way stop intersection, the last driver to stop should be the first to go.
33. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column6: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.

column2: 34. Drivers in Illinois may not wear a headset while driving.

column4: The road will curve to the right.
column8: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
